p: Considering berberine as one of the important constituents of plant Argemone mexicana, very recently, Elizondo-Luevano et al. (2020) compared the anti-trichomonal effect of methanolic extract of leaves and stem of the plant with pristine berberine and metronidazole as a standard control. The IC 50 values of stem and leaf extracts of Argemone mexicana against T. vaginalis were 70.8 and 67.2 μg/mL, respectively. Although the values observed were not comparable to that of metronidazole, IC 50 0.1 μg/mL, they were comparable to pure berberine of IC 50 40.7 μg/mL.
